definition: according to custom/to do as local custom requires/do as the Romans do
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do

sentences.english: When in Rome, do as the Romans do and take the chance to practice your English skills.
sentences.chinese: 入鄉隨俗，同時利用這個機會來練練你的英語吧。

sentences.english: Follow the customs of the new country you are in, or keep your own customs?
sentences.chinese: 入鄉隨俗還是保留自己國家的習俗？

sentences.english: But when you go to the United States, you had better "do as the Romans do."
sentences.chinese: 若你們去美國，最好還是“入境隨俗”。

sentences.english: Why were they like this?For the same reasons many Christians mingle with the world today.
sentences.chinese: 其實，今天的基督徒也有這種隨俗的心態。

sentences.english: For the same reasons many Christians mingle with the world today.
sentences.chinese: 其實，今天的基督徒也有這種隨俗的心態。

sentences.english: They assumed that immigrants would quickly adopt the mores of their host societies.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲，移民會很快入鄉隨俗，向主流社會靠近。

sentences.english: A man must consider what a blind man's-buff is this game of conformity.
sentences.chinese: 一個人必須要想到，隨衆隨俗無異於矇住你的眼睛。

sentences.english: The best way is to not comment, do as the Romans do, as soon as possible into the team.
sentences.chinese: 最好的做法就是不加評論，入鄉隨俗，儘快融入團隊。

sentences.english: They just do so out of social customs.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人這樣做只是隨俗而已。

sentences.english: For nonconformity, the world whips you with its displeasure.
sentences.chinese: 只因不隨俗，整個世界都不悅鞭策着你。

sentences.english: Respect other cultures. Try to blend in as much as possible.
sentences.chinese: 尊重當地文化，要入鄉隨俗。
